intro.title: A Brief Recap
intro.description: Typically, an API (Application Programming Interface) is a set of rules and protocols that allow software to communicate with each other by exchanging data and information. API architecture, in general, is explained in terms of client and server: there is an application that sends a request (client) and an application that sends the response (server).

rtg-overview/core-components/core.title: Core Components
rtg-overview/core-components/core.description: The tool provides researchers and practitioners with some “core components” that are presented in detail below.

rtg-overview/extensible-components/exten.title: Extensible Components
rtg-overview/extensible-components/exten.description: These components are a set of abstract and concrete classes for which researchers or experts might want to provide a new implementation to realise their new testing algorithm.
